metadata.titel_preek: The Advent Life for Nonheroic People

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God (S) delivers and sustains His children (O) in the 'Time Between' (darkness/light), ensuring they are never alone despite their sin.

tekstueel_bewijs: I heard the voice of Jesus saying still to fight on.
He promised never to leave me.
God will root out the works of darkness.
The Sun of Righteousness is forging our armor of light.
Salvation is nearer to us now

zender.identificatie: The Triune God (Source of the Promise)
tekstueel_bewijs: He promised never to leave me
ordinary nonheroic Christians in the pew
God’s children justified in Jesus Christ
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of the promise and the Object of God's forging.

helper.identificatie: The Promise / The Word / The Armor of Light
tekstueel_bewijs: the source of his heroism... was his experience... I heard the voice of Jesus
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Help (Himself).
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that becomes an indwelling power (armor).

tegenstander.identificatie: The Works of Darkness (Sin, Inner Demons, External Evil)
tekstueel_bewijs: inner torment of his obsessive sexual adventuring
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that 'assails us on every side' and requires God to 'root it out' entirely.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Christian (S) puts on the armor of light (O) to live becomingly in the 'Time Between'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Ethical conduct / Small acts of charity
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is the result of the primary program (God's forging and presence).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Promise → God/Jesus ← Works of Darkness

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will not permit the works of darkness to endure.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must find a way to believe.
Every step we take is a step toward darkness or light.

voorbeelden: To be able to live with myself, I have got to do something.
I just want to do something to help.
You know what hour it is.
The Sun of Righteousness is forging our armor.
Nothing will be able to separate us.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's power (Pouvoir) to keep His promise and forge armor, which enables the incompetent human subject.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Darkness/Judgment) through ~S1 (Human Frailty) to ~S2 (God's Promise) and finally S1 (Reconciliation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Sun of Righteousness' who judges the sin (S2) but delivers the child (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; judgment is described as rooting out sin so that neither root nor branch remains.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon maintains God as the primary actor who initiates salvation and sustains the sinner, even when the sinner (King) fails morally.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on human effort in the 'nonheroic' section
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Every act of forgiveness... is a piece of the armor of light.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Do you think that he left Martin King alone at the end because he did not give up his sin?

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: MLK is used as an example, but specifically as a 'non-example' of moral perfection, highlighting 'simul iustus et peccator'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: King is not the hero; the Jesus who spoke to him at the kitchen table is the hero.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and assurance; the burden of 'heroism' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic preservation: God keeps the believer.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'heroic' King to the 'nonheroic' pew-sitter is seamlessly tied together by the universal need for God's presence.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God will root out works of darkness' and 'God will not allow darkness to swallow his children'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God and sinners reconciled... justified in Jesus Christ.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (implied in the voice of Jesus/Armor) provides the 'Pouvoir' to endure.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is an 'inner demon' and 'work of darkness' that requires divine intervention.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is structurally sound, placing God as the Subject of the primary narrative of salvation and presence.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir in the final application.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Ensure the 'small acts' are framed as 'fruit' rather than 'links in chain mail'.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Frame the 'small acts' as the light of Christ shining through the cracks of our nonheroic lives.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as both internal and external.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's promise) correctly precedes and enables Ethics (the Advent life).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining the 'simul' tension while keeping the Gospel as the active engine of the narrative.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the MLK illustration's pathos, Greimas reveals that the illustration's power comes from the Subject-switch (from King's effort to Jesus' promise).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek of Romans 13; Greimas shows how the 'Armor of Light' functions as a modal competence (Pouvoir) given by the Sender.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'nonheroic' listener is moved from a Subject of 'Devoir' (I must help) to a Receiver of 'Pouvoir' (God is forging my armor).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by deconstructing the hero (MLK) into a fellow-sinner dependent on the same Subject (Jesus).
